p: Additionally, it contains an enzyme called bromelain with anti-inflammatory properties. It provides a more remarkable ability to digest food in the body [ 124]. Also, in the food industry, it is used as a meat tenderizer, in the processing of fish and marine products such as the production of oyster sauce, in the manufacture of cookies (to eliminate gluten), as a substitute for sulphones used to prevent browning of fruit juices, in white wine and beer clarification [ 125]. In the same way, it is used in the pharmaceutical industry to treat dyspepsia, infections, cellulitis, edema, and cancer [ 126, 127].
